qas.question: Along with Virginia Key, what does the Rickenbacker Causeway connect to Brickell?
What causeway connects South Beach with Downtown?
Which Miami causeway has the smallest size?
What causeway is furthest to the south?
How many major causeways are in Miami?
Along with Virginia Key, what doesn't the Rickenbacker Causeway connect to Brickell?
What causeway connects South Beach with Uptown?
Which Miami causeway has the largest size?
What causeway is closest to the south?
How many minor causeways are in Miami?

context: Miami has <a4_0><b9_0>six<b9_0/><a4_0/> major causeways that span over Biscayne Bay connecting the western mainland, with the eastern barrier islands along the Atlantic Ocean. The <a3_0><b8_0>Rickenbacker<b8_0/><a3_0/> Causeway is the southernmost causeway and connects Brickell to Virginia Key and <a0_0><b5_0>Key Biscayne<b5_0/><a0_0/>. The Venetian Causeway and <a1_0><b6_0>MacArthur<b6_0/><a1_0/> Causeway connect Downtown with South Beach. The Julia Tuttle Causeway connects Midtown and Miami Beach. The 79th Street Causeway connects the Upper East Side with North Beach. The northernmost causeway, the <a2_0><b7_0>Broad<b7_0/><a2_0/> Causeway, is the smallest of Miami's six causeways, and connects North Miami with Bal Harbour.
